content.description: Sit start on the southeast face. Move forward on positive holds. The move over the lip is sort of blind to a sloper. Top out on slopers.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter will work just fine.
content.location: This boulder is located west of Captain Aslab. The problem is located on the southeast face.

content.description: Sort of sit start with your bum against the lowest part of the rock at your back, unless you are small enough to fit all the way I suppose, finding one good foot high and right, the left foot smears and dangles a bit (I broke everything else). Put your right hand in a three finger side pocket to counter your weight (or start with the right hand side rail to make it harder and lower). Pull up, make a desperate, left hand, overhanging crimp (good for three fingers). Then adjust feet for a big throw with your right to the first decent hold, just to the right of the crack, on that bulge (you'll see it), or you may just try to dyno to the last decent left jug thing above the overhang. Follow the crack to the top. This has good holds, you just got to test them first.
content.protection: Pad, but it is narrow at the bottom.
content.location: It is on the backside of Crossedge Boulder (the side facing the hill).

content.description: Sit start with your feet low under the obvious overhang. Place your left hand in a good pocket and your right on a small crimp. Throw your left hand into an awesome jug, by the bat poo, and then make a strange heel hook-smear move, make it so you can undercling with your right hand and not pop off. Compress and pull up, the hard part is over. Make your way up the face holds instead of the easy off to the right ;)
content.protection: Pad/use caution, these holds are iffy in places.
content.location: This is on the backside (southmost) just to the left of the other climbs already established on this awesome rock.

content.description: Start on a big sidepull in the middle of the west face. Move up and right to some slopers on top. Top out.
content.location: Lame or Casual? is located on the west face of the Crossedge Boulder. The downclimb is on the northwest corner.

content.description:
Start on 2 obvious sidepulls on the left hand side of the west face. From there, make very delicate moves to a 1/3 pad crimp (but good for 4 fingers), then bump to a positive rail. From there, match on the rail, move your feet, and make the move to the lip. It's better than it looks up there.

I just think this problem is a fantastic moderate problem. This is one of my all time favorites in the Valley.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: The route is located on the left side of the west face of the Crossedge Boulder. The downclimb is on the northwest corner where you can hop onto another boulder and come down.

content.description:
Squat start on a left sidepull and a positive ledge. Throw to a left hand sidepull and then a right hand ledge.

Top out on positive holds. The bottom is the crux for sure, and it might be a bit contrived, but it was fun.
content.location: Start on the southwest arete. Downclimb on the northwest corner by hopping to another boulder.
Thjis ascends the middle of the west face of Crossedge Boulder. The downclimb is on the northwest corner. Hop to another rock to get down.
